meta.title: Generate 2-Segment, 3-Beat per segment Uncensored Web3 Mascot Video Scenario (fal-ai/veo3 JSON)
meta.recurringVisual: Invent ONE tangible background detail that appears in **every beat** (street vendor with smoking grill, cracked neon halo, squealing shopping cart, etc.). Must be physical, brand-agnostic, never a floating overlay or logo.

mascotDefinition.what: Exactly stereotypic and very memorabble narrator (gorilla in tank helmet, babushka with plaid mega-bag, Sith stormtrooper, Freddy-crab hybrid — anything iconic).
mascotDefinition.speech: • Talks like a foul-mouthed Web3 degen: swears, drops trading slang, dirty jokes, film quotes, ancient memes. • No hate speech; slurs forbidden. • Uses the language specified by user prompt.
mascotDefinition.rules: • Emotion flip: Segment A one dominant feeling, Segment B the exact opposite.

conceptDefinition.what: One-sentence (< 22 words) log-line summarising both acts and the reversal.

memeDefinition.what: Select ONE viral iconic reference; twist it post-modern style.
memeDefinition.rules: • No on-screen text or UI elements.

meta.userTopic: Treat the user’s next message as thematic core; weave it into every beat.

globalGuidelines.discourseDomain: DeFi, crypto, Web3, blockchain, real-world crypto spending, CrossFi ecosystem products
globalGuidelines.tone: Street-wise, hyper-casual, emotionally overclocked vlogger astonishment. Profanity allowed (f**k, sh*t, damn). Segment A mood X → Segment B mood ¬X.
globalGuidelines.storyArc: Two acts: • Segment A = setup → chaos peak → aftershock. • Segment B = reversal → build-up → twist payoff (≤ 2 s, may be mute). Hero’s fortune/emotion flips between segments.
globalGuidelines.absurdity: Real-world manifestations of digital money: coin hailstorms, cash cyclones, token-shaped junk raining, no holograms/CGI overlays, robots, aliens, absudly rich people.
globalGuidelines.audio: Diegetic only — street noise, mascot ranting, sirens. ≥ 10 spoken words per 8 s segment; final beat may whisper or go silent.
globalGuidelines.framing: Every beat is either mascot close-up or wide crowd mayhem.
globalGuidelines.montage: Single take per segment, three beats (~2-3 s each) separated by visible moves (whip-pan, smash-cut, crash-zoom, phone-shake blur).
globalGuidelines.antiRepetition: No copy-pasted phrases from prior runs; only anchor, crypto terms, mascot nickname, and meme cue may repeat.
globalGuidelines.negativePrompt: on-screen text, captions, UI overlays, holograms, glitch filters, pixel art, low-poly assets, watermarks, branded logos
globalGuidelines.outputFormat: Return **pure JSON** (no markdown) with keys: • "concept" — log-line • "meme" — chosen reference (≤ 3 words) • "segments" — array of 2 objects Each segment keys: • "prompt" (≤ 110 words; 3 beats with “— transition —”) • "negative_prompt" (copy verbatim) • "aspect_ratio": "16:9" • "duration": "8s" • "enhance_prompt": true • "generate_audio": true

element.name: Beat1
element.desc: Setup — mascot reacts to absurd trigger; 4-6 spoken words

element.name: Beat2
element.desc: Climax — chaos or euphoria spikes; 4-6 spoken words

element.name: Beat3
element.desc: Aftershock (Seg A) / Twist payoff (Seg B, ≤ 2 s, may be mute)

promptBlueprint.tip: Anchor appears in EVERY beat; meme cue appears once per segment.

prompt.stepByStep: 1. Invent & pick (keep hidden until JSON). 2. Create mascot nickname & recurring anchor. 3. Draft two ≤ 110-word prompts via blueprint respecting storyArc. 4. Insert userTopic, mascot, anchor in every beat; meme cue once per segment. 5. Ensure ≥ 10 spoken words per segment; profanity allowed. 6. Copy verbatim into both segments. 7. Validate word counts, blacklist, repetition rules. 8. Output final JSON only.
